list_definition.definition: without a cord; not connected to a power supply by wires

list_ex_of_english: There is clear evidence that the use of unapproved cordless telephones causes interference to other radio services, including those used by the emergency services.
A successful prosecution was brought following interference to fire brigade radio communications as a result of the use of unapproved cordless telephone.
Usually cordless, they often have a switch to deactivate the movement circuitry between use, allowing the user freedom of movement without affecting the cursor position.
In some studies, the cordless screwdriver has been shown to be the most efficient and quickest.
Let us take one small example: the aspect of the cordless telephone.
There are clear signs that, in many cases, companies are resisting a move towards cordless headsets, simply because of finance.
There has been some debate about whether the cordless headset is viable or makes sense.
Cordless power tools have made building sites much safer and often in the case of power failure we rely on batteries for back-up lighting or emergency power.
